title: Benn masterclass crushes Eubank in rematch
byline: Conor Benn put on a dominant performance to earn revenge over bitter rival Chris Eubank Jr and seal a unanimous decision victory in their rematch at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

title: Pathirana Headlines IPL 2026 Squad Reveal!
byline: IPL retentions 2026: Full list of retained, released and traded players ahead of auction

title: Education Ministry issues new timetable guidelines for muslim schools
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued new recommendations for implementing revised timetables in Muslim schools as part of the ongoing education reforms.

title: Refugees to face 20-year wait to settle permanently under asylum reforms
byline: People granted asylum in the UK will have to wait 20 years before they can apply to settle permanently, under plans due to be announced by Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood on Monday.

title: Southern Province Governor Bandula Harischandra passes away
byline: Southern Province Governor Bandula Harischandra has passed away this morning (16) while receiving treatment at the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Heavy showers to continue in North, East
byline: Prevailing rainy conditions are expected to continue in the Northern and Eastern Provinces due to the low-pressure area in the vicinity of the island, the Meteorology Department said.

title: SF backs Govt’s anti-corruption efforts, rejects Nov. 21 rally
byline: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka says he is pleased with the direction of the current government, citing its stance against corruption despite limited economic improvement.

title: Doctors to limit key services islandwide from tomorrow
byline: Doctors in all hospitals across the country will limit several key services from tomorrow (Monday, 17), including issuing prescriptions for medicines to be purchased from external pharmacies and recommending laboratory tests to be done at private facilities.

title: Govt has failed to fulfill promises to farmers: Namal claims
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa, criticized the government today, saying it has failed to deliver on promises made to the public during the election. He called on all opposition parties to join a protest in Nugegoda on November 21 to voice their dissent.

title: DMT resumes driver’s licence printing after shortage
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has restarted the printing of driver’s licences after production was halted for weeks due to a shortage of printing cards.

title: Foreigners without valid permits prohibited from driving in Sri Lanka: Police
byline: Police Media Spokesperson ASP F. U. Wootler has reminded that foreign nationals who do not possess a valid International Driving Permit (IDP) or a domestic driving licence from their home country are not permitted to drive any vehicle in Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. targets ’productivity villages’ nationwide by 2030
byline: Sri Lanka aims to transform every village in the country into a “productivity village” by 2030, Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry Secretary Ms. Thilaka Jayasundara, said.

title: Govt. exempts Lanka Sugar Company from statutory payments: Minister
byline: The government has decided to exempt the Lanka Sugar Company from all statutory payments starting January 1, Trade Minister Sunil Handunnetti announced.

title: AG’s Department Legal Officers’ Association opposes proposal to establish separate Public Prosecutions Office
byline: The Legal Officers’ Association of the Attorney General’s Department has formally opposed the proposed establishment of an Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions, asserting that such a move would undermine the department’s independence, efficiency and professional standards.

title: South Africa Leapfrog India in Updated WTC Standings
byline: South Africa have jumped to third in the World Test Championship standings after their victory over India at Eden Gardens, swapping places with Shubman Gill’s side.

title: Man arrested after video of tourist harassment goes viral
byline: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man sought over an incident involving a foreign tourist in Thirukkovil, after a video of the harassment went viral on social media.

title: Israel rejects US-backed push for “pathway” to Palestinian state
byline: Jerusalem on Sunday rejected a joint statement coordinated by the United States and signed by several countries, which called for a “pathway” – a possible route – to Palestinian self-determination and statehood. Several Israeli cabinet members emphasized that Israel would not permit a Palestinian state in either Judea and Samaria or the Gaza Strip.

title: MP Vithana declines budget-allocated cab
byline: MP Jagath Vithana has informed the government that he will not accept the cab allocated to him under the 2026 Budget proposal, which includes importing vehicles for all Members of Parliament.

title: School Development Officers accuse government of failing to honor promises
byline: The School Development Officers’ Association has accused the government of making pre-election promises to secure their votes, only to neglect absorbing them into the teachers’ service.

title: Drug prevention committees to be set up in all govt. institutions
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala said that a circular will be issued tomorrow to establish drug prevention committees in all government institutions.

title: Harmer stars as South Africa stun India in low-scoring Test
byline: Spinner Simon Harmer claimed a match haul of eight wickets to lead South Africa to a thrilling 30-run win over India inside three days of a low-scoring opening Test on Sunday.

title: Tourism sector needs regulation to protect visitors, Says Entrepreneurs’ Association
byline: The Small and Medium Scale Tourism Entrepreneurs Association has urged the government to introduce stronger regulations to safeguard tourists, following several recent incidents of harassment.

title: Refugees to face 20-year wait to settle permanently under asylum reforms
byline: People granted asylum in the UK will have to wait 20 years before they can apply to settle permanently, under plans due to be announced by Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood on Monday.
